title: Preprocessing Dharma 2019 Cohort
text: data dharma 2019 collection stored excel file multiple sheets. , use googledriver package monitor download access. targets pipeline, file called Dharma_followup_2020plus.xlsx tracked First, going load data basic EDA see dharma data collection differs opensrp data collection. Like 2018 data, dharma 2019 data stored list data frames corresponding sheets excel. data dictionary can reference: hopefully tidy reference cohort level data. goal see final structure cohort match : ’ll use Level 1 sheet individual data. ’s column called deleted probably inspect: 105 records removed isn’t many, ’m willing trust missing random. can check missingness gender column: majority time deleted record, also “.” gender. ’s safe assume can go column. purposes getting household heads, need make big assumption column fact_0_id corresponding head household ID. However, column sparse, ie one value lot NAs next value. big assumption true, can use fill() fill values get household head ID individual.
code: tar_load(dharma2019, store = here::here("_targets")) Level 0: Household enrollment  Level 1: Individuals in household Level 2: Antropometric data (every 3 months), dietary intake data collected from head of household (every 4 months), followup data. dharma2019_dict <- dharma2019$`Data Dictionary` dharma2019_dict %>%   fill(level, .direction = "down") -> dharma2019_dict  level_1_dict <- dharma2019_dict %>%   filter(level == 1) level_1_dict #> # A tibble: 118 × 6 #>    level column_name          description          choice_code choice_name type  #>    <dbl> <chr>                <chr>                <chr>       <chr>       <chr> #>  1     1 q39_date             Date                 .           .           Ques… #>  2     1 q1_name              Full name            .           .           Ques… #>  3     1 q167_hh              Is the respondent t… 489         Yes         Ques… #>  4     1 NA                   NA                   490         No          Ques… #>  5     1 q168_wife_husband_hh Is the respondent t… 491         Yes         Ques… #>  6     1 NA                   NA                   492         No          Ques… #>  7     1 q8_gender            Gender of the respo… 18          Male        Ques… #>  8     1 NA                   NA                   19          Female      Ques… #>  9     1 q165_alive           Is the respondent s… 487         Alive       Ques… #> 10     1 NA                   NA                   488         Dead        Ques… #> # ℹ 108 more rows tar_read("cohort_2018_deid", store = here::here("_targets")) %>%   head() #> # A tibble: 6 × 13 #>   uuid   village     hh_head_name name      dob        ethnicity education_level #>   <chr>  <chr>       <chr>        <chr>     <date>     <fct>     <fct>           #> 1 939f09 antaravato1 alexis       alda ale… 2006-09-29 betsimis… primary         #> 2 f9bb3b antaravato1 alexis       alexis    1962-07-31 betsimis… upper_secondary #> 3 034e27 antaravato1 alexis       be leonn… 1976-07-02 betsimis… primary         #> 4 1daa3c antaravato1 alexis       lalatina… 2009-06-25 betsimis… primary         #> 5 396753 antaravato1 alexis       rakotoni… 2004-04-05 betsimis… lower_secondary #> 6 00b9bd antaravato1 alexis       tendry a… 2011-06-09 betsimis… primary         #> # ℹ 6 more variables: employment_status <fct>, profession <fct>, #> #   marital_status <fct>, sex <fct>, submission_date <date>, age_group <fct> cohort_df <- dharma2019$`Level 1 Named` cohort_df %>%   select(deleted) %>%   table() #> deleted #> FALSE  TRUE  #>  1830   105 cohort_df %>%   select(deleted, L1_q8_gender) %>%   table() #>        L1_q8_gender #> deleted   . Female Male #>   FALSE   4    898  928 #>   TRUE   87      4   14 # some na filtering cohort_df %>%   fill(fact_0_id, .direction = "down") %>%   filter(!is.na(L1_q39_date)) %>%   filter(L1_q39_date != ".") %>%    filter(!is.na(L1_q1_name)) %>%   filter(L1_q1_name != ".") %>%    filter(!is.na(L1_q1_name)) %>%   filter(L1_q1_name != ".") %>%    filter(!is.na(L1_q8_gender)) %>%   filter(L1_q8_gender != ".") %>%   filter(!is.na(L1_q2_dob_year)) %>%   filter(L1_q2_dob_year != ".") -> cohort_df_

title: Preprocessing Dharma 2019 Cohort
text: First, need get dataset household head name, can merge cohort data.
code: household_df <- dharma2019$`Level 0 Named` %>%   select(fact_0_id, L0_q2_hh_name) %>%   rename(hh_head_name = L0_q2_hh_name) %>%   distinct() %>%   mutate(hh_head_name = na_if(hh_head_name,".")) %>%   filter(!is.na(hh_head_name))  cohort_df_ <- cohort_df_ %>%   left_join(household_df, by = "fact_0_id")

title: MAHERY Cohort Harmonization
text: Madagascar Health Environmental Research (MAHERY) cohort datasets provide detailed interdisciplinary understanding relationships environmental changes, resource use, human health Madagascar. datasets encompass multiple research initiatives, including Northeast, Antongil, HIARA, cross-sectional studies, addressing unique aspects health environmental interactions. Northeast Dataset: dataset focuses communities near Maroantsetra northeastern Madagascar, local populations heavily rely wild foods nutrition. study examines impact deforestation, biodiversity loss, hunting dietary intake, nutritional status, health outcomes. includes data dietary diversity, disease metrics, environmental resource use[2][3]. Antongil Dataset: Established 2015 along Antongil Bay, dataset evaluates nutritional value seafood effects different fisheries governance models—traditional management, co-management, marine national parks—fish catch, seafood consumption, nutritional outcomes. includes data 225 households across five communities[4]. HIARA Dataset: Initiated 2022 southwestern Madagascar’s Bay Ranobe, study investigates impacts artificial coral reef development fish biomass, fisher livelihoods, nutrition, mental health. involves longitudinal monitoring ecological social systems across 14 communities[1]. Cross-Sectional Studies: studies provide snapshots dietary patterns, nutritional status, socio-economic indicators across various regions. complement longitudinal datasets offering broader demographic insights[2][5]. Together, datasets form comprehensive resource understanding environmental changes influence health outcomes vulnerable populations. Sources [1] HIARA study protocol: impacts artificial coral reef development … https://www.frontiersin.org/journals/public-health/articles/10.3389/fpubh.2024.1366110/full [2] Cohort Profile: Madagascar Health Environmental … https://pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/articles/PMC5837654/ [3] Seasonal trends nutrient intake rainforest communities north … https://pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/articles/PMC10260550/ [4] Cohort Description Madagascar Health Environmental … https://www.frontiersin.org/journals/nutrition/articles/10.3389/fnut.2019.00109/full [5] Cohort Profile: Madagascar Health Environmental … https://academic.oup.com/ije/article/46/6/1747/3868352 [6] Madagascar Health Environmental Research (MAHERY … https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/29040632/ [7] Integrating approaches study land use change hotspots … https://www.thelancet.com/journals/lanplh/article/PIIS2542-5196(18)30104-9/fulltext [8] Madagascar - MAHAY Study 2016, Endline - Microdata Library https://microdata.worldbank.org/index.php/catalog/study/MDG_2016_MAHAY-EL_v01_M [9] Summary PERMANOVA examine influence … - Figshare https://figshare.com/articles/dataset/Summary_of_the_PERMANOVA_to_examine_the_influence_of_explanatory_variables_in_the_variation_of_composition_of_coral_assemblages_/21375118 package establishes pipeline harmonizes MAHERY cohort data across disparate sources produces dataset defines MAHERY Cohort future studies.

title: MAHERY Cohort Harmonization
text: pipeline managed targets, powerful R package reproducible data analysis. allows define series steps (targets) executed order, ensuring analysis reproducible efficient. pipeline deefined _targets.R file. functions create build pipeline defined notebooks dev/ directory, exported R directory using fusen. can run pipeline using following command: current state pipeline: Pipeline Graph
code: library(targets)  tar_make() library(targets) library(DiagrammeR) library(DiagrammeRsvg) library(rsvg) #> Linking to librsvg 2.42.7 library(dplyr) #>  #> Attaching package: 'dplyr' #> The following objects are masked from 'package:stats': #>  #>     filter, lag #> The following objects are masked from 'package:base': #>  #>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union network <- tar_network() #> -\|/-\|/-\|/-\|/-\|/-\- The project is out-of-sync -- use `renv::status()` for details. #> |/-\|/-\|/-  checked: 1 | outdated: 0\  checked: 13 | outdated: 0 #> |/   # Optional: filter out internal targets like `.Random.seed` vertices <- network$vertices %>% filter(!grepl("^\\.", name))  # Build node declarations node_lines <- sprintf('  "%s";', vertices$name)  # Filter edges to match cleaned nodes edges <- network$edges %>%   filter(from %in% vertices$name, to %in% vertices$name)  # Build edge connections edge_lines <- sprintf('  "%s" -> "%s";', edges$from, edges$to)  # Assemble DOT graph string dot_code <- c("digraph targets_pipeline {", node_lines, edge_lines, "}") dot_string <- paste(dot_code, collapse = "\n")  # Create grViz graph graph <- grViz(dot_string)  svg_path <- "man/figures/pipeline_dag.svg" svg_string <- export_svg(graph) writeLines(svg_string, svg_path)

title: Generate a short, deterministic unique identifier — generate_uid
text: salt character string used base salt hashing. Defaults "cohort_secret". ... Additional values combined salt generate UID. Typically, might include identifiers names, dates, stable fields. nchar Integer specifying number characters return hashed result. Default 6.

title: Generate a short, deterministic unique identifier — generate_uid
text: character string representing short, deterministic unique identifier.

title: Generate a short, deterministic unique identifier — generate_uid
text: function uses SHA-256 hash algorithm (via digest package) truncates result desired number characters. UID deterministic: inputs always produce output.

title: Generate a short, deterministic unique identifier — generate_uid

title: Process Visual Deformities Data — process_deformities
text: function harmonizes cleans deformity-related health data collected two columns: visual_health_deformities other_visual_health_deformities. merges two sources, removes placeholder text, translates free-text values standardized English terms, returns new column deformities_clean.

title: Process Visual Deformities Data — process_deformities
text: modified data frame added deformities_clean character column, containing cleaned translated deformity labels.

title: Process Visual Deformities Data — process_deformities
text: Specific cleaning steps include: Merging visual_health_deformities other_visual_health_deformities present Lowercasing removing prefixes like "deformities, " Translating common Malagasy ambiguous phrases standardized terms: "balana" → "strabismus" "simba maso ilany" → "one_eye_non_functional" "tongotra" → "malformed_foot" "kondohalitry" → "severe_bowleggedness" "missing teeth" → "missing_teeth"

title: MAHERYCohortHarmonization 1.1.0 (2025-06-06)
text: Implemented to_pinboard function standardize uploads R objects files Google Drive pin board shared folder. Added documentation to_pinboard function, including parameters examples. Created new R Markdown file flat_reporting_pins.Rmd serve template reporting pins package. Updated configuration config_fusen.yaml include new R script tests. Added tests to_pinboard function test-to_pinboard.R. Created vignette reporting--pins--google-drive.Rmd demonstrate usage to_pinboard function. Updated various documentation files reflect new version 1.0.0 package. Added images demonstration purposes vignette.

title: MAHERYCohortHarmonization 1.0.0 (2025-06-06)
text: major update introduces closes first milestone package NSAPH-Data-Processing/MAHERYCohortHarmonization#3. , developed reproducible analysis package MAHERY cohort harmonization project, includes: - comprehensive set functions data preprocessing, cleaning, harmonization. - standardized lookup table health diagnoses. - Documentation vignettes guide users package functionalities. summary key commits: Introduced preprocess_2018_health function streamline health data processing. Introduced new functions clean_2018_pregnancy clean_2018_vaccinations corresponding documentation tests. Improved create_health_diagnoses function documentation clarify purpose output. Updated inflate function call flat_tracking_inputs.Rmd prevent opening vignette automatically. Added “Changelog” link various HTML documents better navigation. Updated pkgdown.yml reflect latest Pandoc version last built date. Enhanced malagasy_diagnosis_lookup_table updated mappings health diagnoses. Made minor formatting code style improvements across various files consistency. Update .Rbuildignore enhance health diagnosis function documentation Introduced new article: Preprocessing 2018 Health Status. Added functions: create_health_diagnoses preprocess_2018_health. Created malagasy_diagnosis_lookup_table standardized health diagnoses. Updated pkgdown version 2.1.3 pandoc 3.6.3. Updated OutputTables vignette include health diagnoses lookup table. Configured devcontainer development VS Code locally
